meanings.definition: A soft, white substance formed when milk sours
meanings.sent1: The chef added curds to the soup for a creamy texture.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy eating curds with honey for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten pounced on the curds, mistaking them for snowballs.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like curds forming in warm milk.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight illuminated the curds, creating a magical glow in the dark.

meanings.definition: To coagulate or form into curds
meanings.sent1: The rennet helps curds to develop in the cheese-making process.
meanings.sent2: If you add lemon juice, the milk will curdle and curds will appear.
meanings.sent3: The paint curds on the palette, waiting to be mixed into vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts curds together, forming a solid decision in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The emotions curds within her, ready to spill out in tears of joy.
